IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CENTRE COLLEGE IS AN EDUCATIONAL COMMUNITY DEDICATED TO STUDY IN THE LIBERAL ARTS AS A MEANS TO DEVELOP THE INTELLECTUAL, PERSONAL, AND MORAL POTENTIAL OF ITS STUDENTS
IRS990.MissionDesc: CENTRE COLLEGE IS A SMALL, INDEPENDENT, AND SELECTIVE EDUCATIONAL COMMUNITY DEDICATED TO STUDY IN THE LIBERAL ARTS AS A MEANS TO DEVELOP THE INTELLECTUAL, PERSONAL, AND MORAL POTENTIAL OF ITS STUDENTS. CENTRE NURTURES IN ITS STUDENTS THE ABILITY TO THINK LOGICALLY AND CRITICALLY, TO WORK CREATIVELY, TO ANALYZE AND COMPARE VALUES, AND TO WRITE AND SPEAK WITH CLARITY AND GRACE. IT ACQUAINTS STUDENTS WITH THE RANGE OF ACCOMPLISHMENTS OF THE HUMAN MIND AND SPIRIT IN A VARIETY OF ARTS AND THEORETICAL DISCIPLINES. IT ENABLES STUDENTS TO CHOOSE AND FULFILL SIGNIFICANT RESPONSIBILITIES IN SOCIETY. IN SHORT, CENTRE'S HIGHEST PRIORITY IS TO PREPARE ITS STUDENTS FOR LIVES OF LEARNING, LEADERSHIP, AND SERVICE.
IRS990.Desc: FOUNDED IN 1819, THE SOLE MISSION OF CENTRE, A NATIONALLY RANKED RESIDENTIAL CO-ED PRIVATE LIBERAL ARTS COLLEGE, IS TO PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL POST-SECONDARY UNDERGRADUATE EDUCATION TO ITS STUDENTS. WE GUARANTEE THE OPPORTUNITY TO STUDY ABROAD, TO HAVE AN INTERNSHIP, AND TO GRADUATE IN FOUR YEARS. TO DEVELOP A GLOBAL PERSPECTIVE, ABOUT 85 PERCENT OF OUR STUDENTS STUDY ABROAD, WITH CENTRE PROFESSORS, AT LEAST ONCE. COUPLED WITH SMALL CLASSES, HIGH GRADUATION RATES, ENGAGED PROFESSORS, AND REAL-WORLD PREPARATION FOR CAREER, GRADUATES ENJOY A HIGH SUCCESS RATE FOR EMPLOYMENT OR GRADUATE DEGREE ACCEPTANCE.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: VP FOR LEGAL AFFAIRS AND GIFT

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: FUNDS HELD IN TRUST BY OTHERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ADDITION TO THE EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER NOTICE THAT APPEARS WITH ALL OF CENTRE'S EMPLOYMENT ADS, THE COLLEGE HAS AN OFFICIAL NONDISCRIMINATION STATEMENT THAT IS REPRINTED IN MAJOR PUBLICATIONS SUCH AS OUR INTRODUCTION-TO-THE-COLLEGE BROCHURE, THE ADMISSION VIEWBOOK, AND THE CATALOG. THE STATEMENT ALSO APPEARS ON THE COLLEGE'S WEBSITE.

CENTRE COLLEGE RECEIVES GRANTS FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, EPA, NIST, NEH, THE DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE, AND NSF. THE COLLEGE ALSO RECEIVES SUBSIDIZED AND UNSUBSIDIZED LOANS, FLUS LOANS, AND PERKINS LOANS.
ALL STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS OR OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED THROUGHOUT THE AWARD, ACCEPTANCE AND APPLICATION PROCESSES. APPROPRIATE RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED AND DOCUMENTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, OR OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED THROUGHOUT THE AWARD, ACCEPTANCE, AND APPLICATION PROCESSES. APPROPRIATE RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED AND DOCUMENTED.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: VP FOR LEGAL AFFAIRS AND GIFT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: HOUSING ALLOWANCE: JOHN ROUSH, PRESIDENT, STEPHANIE FABRITIUS, DEAN, AND BRIAN HUTZLEY, VP FINANCE & TREASURER ARE REQUIRED TO RESIDE IN ON-CAMPUS HOUSING PER THEIR EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT. EXEMPT UNDER IRC 119. TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS: AT TIMES SPOUSES ARE EXPECTED TO ACCOMPANY INTERESTED PERSONS ON BUSINESS TRIPS. ANY AMOUNTS DEEMED TO BE PERSONAL IN NATURE ARE TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION. HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB: THE COLLEGE PURCHASED A MEMBERSHIP IN THE LOCAL COUNTRY CLUB IN THE PRESIDENT'S NAME TO GAIN ACCESS TO THE FACILITIES FOR OCCASIONAL BUSINESS PURPOSES. THE USE IS 100% BUSINESS AND NOT CONSIDERED TO BE TAXABLE COMPENSATION.
BONUSES ARE EARNED BASED ON MEETING GOALS SET AT THE BEGINNING OF THE YEAR BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 3 - TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUES - 2008 BOND
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN PART I(E)B ISSUE PRICE AND PART II, LINE 3B TOTAL PROCEEDS OF $1,290,876 IS THE RESULT OF INVESTMENTS EARNINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART IV, LINE 2C - EXCEPTION TO REBATE
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOND PROCEEDS HAVE BEEN SPENT. THEREFORE THE REBATE CALCULATION DOES NOT NEED TO BE PERFORMED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART IV, LINE 4B - NAME OF PROVIDER
SCHEDULE L, PART III - GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE BENEFITING INTERESTED PERSONS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOLS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO IDENTIFY INTERESTED PERSONS TO WHOM THEY HAVE PROVIDED SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND SIMILAR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE INSTRUCTIONS TO FORM 990, SCH L.
THE FORM 990-T IS FILED AT THE SAME TIME AS THE 990.

THERE SHALL BE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES APPOINTED EACH YEAR BY THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD, AND APPROVED BY VOTE OF THE BOARD. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE ALL THE POWERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WHEN THE BOARD IS NOT IN SESSION, EXCEPT THE POWER TO ELECT OR REMOVE THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE, TO AMEND THE CHARTER AND BYLAWS OF THE COLLEGE, AND TO ELECT NEW TRUSTEES. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL CONSIST OF NINE OR MORE MEMBERS, INCLUDING THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD, THE VICE CHAIR OF THE BOARD AND THE SECRETARY OF THE BOARD. ANY ACTION OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO BE EFFECTIVE MUST BE AUTHORIZED BY AT LEAST FIVE AFFIRMATIVE VOTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DAVID GRISSOM AND SANDRA FRAZIER HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 AND SUPPLEMENTAL SCHEDULES IS PREPARED BY THE CONTROLLER WITH ASSISTANCE FROM AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE FINAL FORM 990 AND SUPPLEMENTAL SCHEDULES WAS PROVIDED ELECTRONICALLY TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS. SUPPLEMENTAL SCHEDULES WAS PROVIDED ELECTRONICALLY TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

ALL TRUSTEES AND OFFICERS ARE SURVEYED ANNUALLY, VIA AN EXTENSIVE QUESTIONNAIRE, TO DISCLOSE A VARIETY OF RELATIONSHIPS WITH EACH OTHER OR DIRECTLY WITH THE COLLEGE. THIS SURVEY IS REVIEWED AND MAINTAINED BY COLLEGE COUNSEL, AND REVIEWED BY BOTH THE VP FINANCE AND THE CONTROLLER. THOSE FOUND TO HAVE A POTENTIAL CONFLICT, OR THE APPEARANCE OF SUCH, DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN FINAL RELATED BUSINESS DISCUSSIONS OR VOTES.

THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS A COMMITTEE ON COMPENSATION AND PERFORMANCE EVALUATION, COMPOSED OF EIGHT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD, WHICH REVIEW PERFORMANCE OF THE PRESIDENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. AS PART OF THE EVALUATION OF THE PRESIDENT, THE COMMITTEE REVIEWS AN EXPANSIVE REPORT WRITTEN BY THE PRESIDENT ON THE DRIVERS AND GOALS ASSOCIATED WITH HIS WORK, AND ALSO REVIEWS OBJECTIVE INSTITUTIONAL DATA. IN SETTING THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT IN THE PRESIDENT'S CURRENT CONTRACT, THE COMMITTEE EMPLOYS AN INDEPENDENT CONSULTANT WHO PROVIDES AN ASSESSMENT OF COMPENSATION FROM COMPARABLE PRESIDENTS AT COMPARABLE COLLEGES. FOR THE CURRENT CONTRACT, THE CONSULTANT PROVIDED RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE COMMITTEE, WHICH THEN MADE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES APPROVES THE BASE SALARY FOR THE PRESIDENT UNDER THE CURRENT CONTRACT, AND HAS ESTABLISHED A MAXIMUM PERCENTAGE FOR ANY ANNUAL INCENTIVE COMPENSATION. EACH YEAR, IN CONNECTION WITH THE EVALUATION OF THE PRESIDENT, THE COMMITTEE MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS ON ANY INCENTIVE COMPENSATION FOR WHICH THE PRESIDENT IS ELIGIBLE, SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION OF CONTRACT DISCUSSIONS, APPROVALS, ATTENDANCE, AND ACTIONS TAKEN ARE MAINTAINED ON CAMPUS BY A NON-BOARD MEMBER. THE PRESIDENT IS CURRENTLY COMPLETING THE THIRD YEAR OF A FIVE-YEAR CONTRACT.
AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE. CURRENTLY THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE MADE AVAILABLE BY THE IRS.
ACTUARIAL LIABILITY FOR ANNUITY OBLIGATIONS: (277,683) VALUATION CHANGE IN INTEREST RATE SWAPS: 2,509,485 TOTAL: 2,231,802
